title: I'll be mildly upset if Morde's rework Login screen isn't some sort of Metal ballad
body:
https://m.youtube.com/watch?v=n1kTxfjjSu4

It would just be too good of an opportunity to pass up.

replies.body: Me too, though Black Metal feels more appropriate then Power Metal. I'm disappointed MM.

What?!
I got out-Metaled?!

Impossible!

*combusts into metal explosion*

~~I fucking love you Reav3~~

No, he just searched up diferent type of metals, re-typed his search to metal music when he got a periodic table, then related black metal to Mordekaiser.

Boom. You just got out-metaled by someone who doesn't even metal.

*Guitar riff*

I actually used to be pretty hard core into Black Metal at one point. Still listen to my old favorites (Dimmu Borgir & Emperor are 2 of my favorites.) Don't follow it as much anymore though. Mostly listen to Industrial stuff nowadays. I love me some Blind Guardian too though. "A Night at The Opera" is one of my all time favorite metal albums, that and "Still Life" by Opeth.

I have no idea what we are talking about but I will nod my head and smile and say, "wake me up inside."

Am I a steel type yet?

You're getting there.
It's the thought that counts.

In the words of a wise man:
"It's not the Metal on the outside that counts, but the one on the inside."
All the iron in my blood just got excited.

Isn't mordekaiser empty inside though?

oh god his character really *is* more than a bunch of references, he actually is a metaphor for metal.
out-metaled

Eh, Blind Guardian could go more power. Great band. I thought of Voice in the Dark as another track, but hell, this... 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4bDVPLDppvE 

...is good for that more evil feel.

Sometimes I bang two spoons together and it occasionally makes a loud sound.

Am I metal now?

Definitely black metal for Morde.
Something like Mother North.

If his new login isn't at all metal related then Riot fucked up big time.

*Login theme is two pieces of steel being scraped against each other repeatedly*
endless suffering

There is a part of me that wants it to be, I don't know, K-Pop just to see your reaction. 

But yeah, it has to be metal. Riot would have to be idiots not to.
K- Metal?
babymetal?
Please no

Oh but you're fine with some NON metal music representing Mordekaiser?!

Bish if I had rings I'd be taking em off.
https://i.ytimg.com/vi/ANH-v-jd9PQ/maxresdefault.jpg?noredirect
If the song isn't "Back in Black" by AC/DC, I'm going to set a bag of crap on fire right on the doorstep of the Morde rework team leader.
What if Morde's armor isn't black though
I thought it was black and ashy doh.
A login screen of Mordekaiser walking with his mace on a path of corpses like the badass he is.
And i'm surprised nobody is upset that you're making up demand after demands to Riot on how you want Morde to be.

''I'll be mildly upset if...''

''You're making up **Demand** after **Demands** ...''

k buddy

> ''I'll be mildly upset if...''

When did i say any of that?

That's what MM said. In the title of this damn post.

''I'll be mildly upset if...''

That's not exactly a demand, like you're claiming it is.

Okay but why would it need to be pointed out? I'm upset as hell that Janna's real backstory got destroyed and turned into a non-existent lifeguard guarding misty waters or whatever-the-fuck instead of what she was before. Doesn't matter, beacause as long as the "many" prevail, the few that think for themselves will be shunned.

Unless you control the idiotic mob with memes as if that even means anything. Sadly, that is the key on the Boards. One i'll never exploit.

But whatever, my point is, he's making these posts all the time and i'm pretty sure that since nobody posts about Mordekaiser with a few exceptions from time to time, they'll try to eventually fit him the closest to MM's "vision" of him since he may aswell write a book on Mordekaiser at this point and how great he is.

So you're upset that MM's suggestions are getting attention (Which you assume will define Morde's actual VGU)
Because you don't like the fact that Janna's backstory isn't the way it should be in your, rather irrelevant, view?

Try being a likeable person and people might be interested in what you have to say.

But for now, I'd recommend asking yourself if you're angry at MM for being passionate about Mordekaiser, or if you're angry at Riot because you FEEL like Riot will shape Morde after MM's Vision of him.

I repeat, you FEEL like that's going to happen.

> Because you don't like the fact that Janna's ...

Never said that. It was a comparison in how when i spoke up, i got backlash because my opinion was disregarded as "some random guy's whining" instead of "our meme lord has spoken. He must be right!".

> Try being a likeable person and people might be interested in what you have to say.

I don't care what you think is likeable. None of the "approved" members have done anything but spam memes either  so don't expect me to sink that low either.

> But for now, I'd recommend asking yourself if you're angry at MM for being passionate about Mordekaiser, or if you're angry at Riot because you FEEL like Riot will shape Morde after MM's Vision of him.

No i'm angry if they'll turn Mordekaiser into a walking pop-culture reference like MM wants and in turn, not be a Shadow Isles champion at all. He's supposted to be a scary looking Master of Death not a joke with references.

I'm not scared MM turns his gameplay into shit because there are better players than him with far more valid opinions, i'm scared i won't be able to take him seriously anymore because the theme of the champion may aswell be dedicated to MM at this point since everybody else is "inferior" in opinion.

You don't have to be a ''meme lord'' to be liked.

Mira, for example, is mainly liked because of her Gameplay posts.
Hell, even MM himself started off in Gameplay.

You really have things mixed up here. You're not viewed as a random person whining because you're not funny.
You're viewed as a random person whining because that is exactly what you are.

Also your ''concern'' about Mordekaiser being turned inot a walking pop-culture reference is rather rediculous.
Riot gets feedback from **a lot** of players. And League of Legends is a big game. 
ONE person's posts won't be the pillar Mordekaiser gets build around.

> Mira, for example, is mainly liked because of her Gameplay posts.
Hell, even MM himself started off in Gameplay.

I don't know who Mira is because i don't use the Filter by Category a lot. She/He must not get on the front page very often then.

And i know where MM started off, he still became a "meme lord" and embraced it. Now, nobody dares to question him because he's obviously the "only person who must know what they're talking about when it comes to Mordekaiser".

> You're viewed as a random person whining because that is exactly what you are.

Good job proving that by...just a random accusation? Okay.

And you're just another brainwashed follower of the crowd who can't think for themselves so they'll protect their overlord from people like me who do.

See? I can do it too.

> Also your ''concern'' about Mordekaiser being turned inot a walking pop-culture reference is rather rediculous.
Riot gets feedback from a lot of players. And League of Legends is a big game.
ONE person's posts won't be the pillar Mordekaiser gets build around.

I made a rather unpopular post with about 5 upvotes and 3 downvotes talking about how Conqueror Karma's face and body shape didn't match up with her Original Splash Art.

It was a 50 - 50 and i honestly checked around if anybody else was mentioning it...well no, nobody. And they changed it regardless. I'm not saying other regions didn't mention this at all and i was the sole reason but i'll have the benfit of doubt for this region at least.

It's not a major change, but if Riot feels a change is in the right direction, they'll do it even if it's the few suggesting it as long as it feels right to THEM. It all comes down to intuition and the main reason the NA Boards are heavily populated is because of Riot's developers mainly being here which means everybody's content gets more recognition/attention on a bigger "stage".

She does.

I'll call MM a Moron whenever he acts like one. He's well aware of that.

> She does.

And i check the front page frequently every day together with authors of the posts. Not really.

> I'll call MM a Moron whenever he acts like one. He's well aware of that.

The Boards mods will get you banned for it, as tempting as it can be.

> And what is that last part even supposed to prove?

That even a few can make big changes. Think a little!

Not sure if this is even a demand.
Just a thought. But MM seems to tie Morde to metal.
They may aswell be. Because nobody plays Mordekaiser given his rework that turned him garbage and the fact he's in "Riot's good book of champion X mains so we'll make sure to fulfill their wishes".

There's nothing wrong with pitching an idea for Morde's future update.
I get that some champion mains think if they make posts on a daily basis, that Riot will give them exactly what they want but i don't think this is that thread.

You must be new here. MM is like the biggest Morde main the NA/EU Boards know and he's been posting since...before i even arrived here in 2014.

You really think they won't take MM's wishes as a template for a successful fantasy outcome?

Well, they haven't done that so far with any of the past reworks/updates.
Riot does take our feedback into account but they never port our ideas 100% on a champion's design. They always like to put their own twist to it and i respect that.

But there's always a first time for everything.
I don't think what MM is proposing is a bad idea but i still don't want Morde to end up as a amalgamation of metal genre in a champion, without not having a strong thematic tied to his theme. So far, what i've gathered is that Morde is supposed to be the  Death Revenant and he has to be spoopy. I don't think metal can do the job here but just a Login Screen might be what he needs.

Also we have to take into an account that he's in the Pentakill group so he definitely has to pay an omage to that.
